posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
A sheer guess here... possibly a DEX halfling clc24/mnk10/sd6 (yes, I realize you already get HiPS for free, but that is not the point of the suggested combo) to max the stealth and enchant the throwing weapons via divine buffs so they do better damage.  In robes, you'll get the monk WIS AC which can be buffed up and even empowered.  Eat the 20% XP penalty.

I'm betting you could reach Epic Dodge pretty quickly so if you can finesse any of those nunchuks or whatever the others are (am assuming they are melee weapons of some sort) you'd retain an equally high AB range or melee.  You won't be getting the monk progression for melee unless they customized qualifying weapons other than kamas. 

With cleric's ability to buff AB without an uber primary attack ability (in this case, DEX), you could get by with just 25-26 to qualify for ED and dump the rest in CHA to get some damage help from Div Might. But I suspect feat-starvation may push pre-epic feats into epic levels to do so.  You'd need STR 13/min CHA 13 but I wouldn't worry about going nuts with WIS since it would be a self-buffer, not offensive caster, so probably 16 should do fine.  You only need level 6 slots to extend Battletide, the latest of the buffs, and you'll get Greater Sanctuary to help with stealth.  The added levels are just there for slots, buff duration and to avoid dispels.

That should be enough to lay out a design. Why not try pasting something together yourself and we can help you fine-tune it?  Don't worry about any skills but Tumble for the moment.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Not a bad idea at all, dude.. But it could be better and it could be legit once you satisfy the prereqs.  A few points...

Take 8 Levels of Rog Pre-epic for a Rog8/Ftr8/Mnk4 split.  It will net the same BAB 17 but you can get WS/EWS in epic with those 2 Ftr levels.  You may need to forego Toughness, Luck of Heroes and/or Lightning Reflexes (pick 2 of those for the specialization), but with your high APR, specialization can really add up for a DEXer especially if it is not a cleric.

Not sure how you got to STR 7 with "Negatives: None" but you shouldn't allow STR lower than 10 if you can help it.  My DEXer DP clerics have begun setting their minimum STR at 14 these days because it makes so much difference dispatching flankers quickly even with the divine dmg factored in.  At any rate, I realize you are attempting to glean extra WIS AC with WIS 16 but you can't afford to do it.  Use Owl's WIS pots and scrolls to boost it. Expertise needs INT 13+ so you'd probably want to start with INT 12 +2 subrace = INT 14 at least.  This is (or should be) a very highly-skilled build so you can control most situations.  A ninja is famous for that sort of thing.

Disarm/ImpDisarm is an interesting choice but don't try it with a kama.  The penalty is just too high.  -6 AB is tough enough with unarmed strikes.

You'll want Epic Dodge much earlier.  If you want to strive for Monk 20, that's ok, but UMD 40+ is really not worth it.  With the swap of 2 Ftr for 2 Rog, you could get ED as early as level 27.  But if you delay Rog 10 until Lvl 30, UMD will reach 33 (32) so with a single Eagle pot pre-buff you can cast all scrolls w/o failure (dunno if your server uses hardcore scroll check or not, so if not, UMD 31 (30) is adequate to equip and use very expensive items).  Your main dump skills with monk should be tumble, discipline and concentration (if taunt is a threat and you have enough points to do it) plus keeping pace with stealth skills and probably Listen.

Your AB stat doesn't jive.

Unarmed: BAB 27 + 11dex + 1WF + 2EWF + 1 prowess = 42 (that one matches) but,
Kama: BAB 27 + 11dex + 1prowess = 39

You can't take Imp TWF without both Ambidexterity and TWF.  Not sure if you can fit all 3 feats into this build without giving up other feats.  I'd say probably not. I see ImpExpertise as candidate for swap along with the other 3 feats I mentioned before.   I like the dual weapon idea, but am thinking you may need to give up monk 20 for more fighter feats in epic to focus in both weapons.  Depends what you feel is the most important.  If you invest into all the DW feats for the kamas, you really need to focus in both weapons.  If you can buy/find scrolls of Flame Weapon or Darkfire, you'll probably stick with kamas until deciding a stun attempt or disarm attack is due.

Haven't tried to check your saves or AC yet.  The saves don't make sense so maybe were a typo.  The AC will likely change with the changes I've suggested.

I'll wait to find out if there are any "hidden" server-specific factors that may have contributed to solving any of these issues before going further.  Work through them one at a time and you will be able to submit sample builds for requests and get recommendations that mean something to your design instincts in the future.  Thanks for trying so hard, mate!

Judging from the stats he listed, he is only figuring on 1-12 bludgeon unarmed.  The fact that he listed single and DW kamas seemed to infer he was going to be using either weapon depending on the situation.  At least that's the way I was interpreting the listing.  Apparently he is focused more on building up his BAB and combat feats in pre-epic than advancing the monk class fast. Considering he positioned himself for ED at Level 27 (even though he waited much later), the build accomplishes a great deal by mid-epic.  Now, if he could get the prereqs figured out, there will probably be room for focusing and specializing in both weapon types.  I suspect submitting self-designed builds is a new experience for the OP but one worth encouraging.

If that's the main reason for unarmed strike (because kamas will suck at disarm), then drop Dodge and ImpCrit: Unarmed.  Use your DW kamas for the major attack.  Your fists will have the same AB and +6 EWS damage as the kama but smaller crit range which doesn't matter for disarm.  I wouldn't try a non-monk weapon because you'll lose the monk attack progression.  At AB of 46, your fists will attempt a disarm at AB 42 which is not bad at all.   With fists, it doesn't matter what the opposed weapon size is.  The penalty is always -4 for the improved version.

The changes would be: Level 1 : Blind Fight, Level 6: Disarm, Level 14 (ftr bonus): Imp Disarm.

BTW, just so you know... there is a -20% XP penalty during most of the leveling sequence. Really no way around it without screwing up all the skill dumps.  This class combo usually does have penalty, though.

Yes.
Would that be worth it for 1 extra attack?
I doubt it...
...which is why I furnished David a sanitized version of his dual-focus idea. With the prereqs for earliest ED, the need for pre-epic fighter feats to focus/specialize in both weapons and access to the earliest epic specialization damage,  it's only possible to reach Monk 16 very late in the build (either at Level 34 or 36 depending on when Ftr9-10 is scheduled).  Since it's a support attack method anyway, the extra damage is lesser priority.  The DW kamas will reach the 10 APR milestone hasted FoB with 2 of those attacks at full BAB all with EWS damage included so will far-exceed that of the unarmed attack especially if scroll buffs are available.
